article.headline: Portland 70, Winthrop 64
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Darren Cooper and Donald Wilson had 15 points each to lead Portland to a 70-64 win over Winthrop on Monday. Freshman Jeremiah Dominguez added 13 points in 19 minutes for the Pilots (8-3), who overcame 41 percent shooting by committing just eight turnovers. Torrell Martin led Winthrop (7-3) with 16 points and Chris Gaynor added 13. The Eagles shot 49 percent, but turned the ball over 19 times. The game had 11 lead changes until Portland scored six straight points to take a 55-49 lead with 8:04 left. Gaynor later hit a 3-pointer to get Winthrop within 63-61, but the Eagles could never even the score. The Pilots enjoyed an edge on the inside, outscoring the Eagles 28-16 in the paint. They also had eleven more free throw attempts. Winthrop shot 52 percent in the first half, including 6-of-12 from 3-point range, but could only manage a 32-30 lead at the break. ^
